channel.title: Finance
channel.description: Latest investing news and finance headlines straight from Wall Street.

item.title: Stocks making the biggest moves midday: Nikola, Las Vegas Sands, Stitch Fix, Crocs and more
item.description: These are the stocks posting the largest moves in midday trading.

item.title: Nikola shares surge 18% after company delivers its first EV truck, says more to come
item.description: Nikola shares jumped 20% on Thursday after the electric truck maker completed delivery of its first vehicle.

item.title: Stocks making the biggest moves premarket: Novavax, Tesla, JD.com Nikola and others
item.description: These are the stocks posting the largest moves before the bell.

item.title: What the top crypto execs predict for the industry in 2022: Regulation and a Big Tech 'brain drain'
item.description: Some of the cryptocurrency industry's most influential executives told CNBC about their 2022 expectations.

item.title: JD.com tanks after Tencent says it will give away most of its stake in e-commerce giant to shareholders
item.description: Shares of JD.com plunged 7% on Thursday after Tencent announced it will be giving most of its shares in the e-commerce giant away.

item.title: European stocks rise on signs of hope about omicron
item.description: European stocks finished slightly higher Thursday as traders looked to signs that the coronavirus omicron variant is not as severe as previously feared.

item.title: S&P 500 closes at a record following 3-day rebound from omicron sell-off
item.description: The major averages rose for a third day on Thursday as investors looked past earlier jitters about the spread of the omicron Covid variant.

item.title: Stocks making the biggest moves midday: Tesla, CarMax, BlackBerry and more
item.description: These are the stocks posting the largest moves in midday trading.

item.title: Options trading activity hits record powered by retail investors, but most are playing a losing game
item.description: Many retail investors are buying the most basic call and put options, which have a much lower probability of profit than advanced strategies like spreads.

item.title: Stocks making the biggest moves premarket: CarMax, Tesla, BlackBerry and others
item.description: These are the stocks posting the largest moves before the bell.

item.title: From a bitcoin crash to regulatory crackdowns: Analysts give their top predictions for crypto in 2022
item.description: With heightened regulatory scrutiny and intense price fluctuations, some analysts are bearish on bitcoin's prospects.

item.title: Dow jumps 260 points, rising for a second day as investors look past omicron threat
item.description: The market continued to rebound from a three-day losing streak spurred by fears about the omicron Covid variant.

item.title: Tuesday's market bounce could lead to a record 2022, Oppenheimer's top strategist says
item.description: Oppenheimer Asset Management’s John Stoltzfus believes in the recent market bounce and sees improving fundamentals ahead.

item.title: Stocks making the biggest moves midday: Citrix Systems, Boeing, Nike, Kellogg and more
item.description: These are the stocks posting the largest moves in midday trading.

item.title: Stocks making the biggest moves in the premarket: Nike, Micron Technology, Braze and more
item.description: The stocks making the biggest moves in premarket trading include Nike, Micron Technology, Braze, and more.

item.title: 'Santa rally' won't rekindle due to omicron risks and profit-taking, PNC Financial's CIO predicts
item.description: PNC Financial's Amanda Agati sees near-term trouble, but she's optimistic the market will see gains in 2022.

item.title: Dow jumps 560 points as market rebounds from omicron-triggered 3-day slide
item.description: The major averages rebounded sharply on Tuesday following three days of losses amid fears about the fast-spreading Covid omicron variant.

item.title: Backdoor Roth 401(k) and IRA rules for the wealthy survive — for now
item.description: Sen. Joe Manchin, D-W.Va., said Sunday he won't support the Build Back Better Act in its current form. That delays tax proposals slated to take effect in 2022.

item.title: Stocks making the biggest moves midday: Oracle, Carnival, Devon Energy and more
item.description: These are the stocks posting the largest moves in midday trading.

item.title: Stocks making the biggest moves premarket: Moderna, Royal Caribbean, Cerner and others
item.description: These are the stocks posting the largest moves before the bell.

item.title: Cash grab or innovation? The video game world is divided over NFTs
item.description: Ubisoft debuted a platform that lets players own in-game cosmetic items in the form of NFTs. The move was met with widespread anger from gamers.

item.title: Stocks slide to start the week as omicron fears intensify, Dow falls 430 points
item.description: Investors continued to assess the impact from the pandemic and an upcoming shift in easy monetary policy.

item.title: 'Cash could be your friend': Wilmington Trust sees a deeper pullback providing better opportunities for investors
item.description: Even though she’s optimistic on 2022, Wilmington Trust’s Meghan Shue believes the market is ripe for a deeper near-term pullback.

item.title: Chinese electric car start-up Nio reveals a new sedan, augmented reality glasses
item.description: Chinese electric car company Nio revealed Saturday a new sedan and custom augmented reality glasses that reduce the need for in-car screens.

item.title: Kickstarter, Discord and others are raving about ‘Web3.' Their users give them a reality check
item.description: The "Web3" movement aims to create a decentralized version of the internet. And big companies like Kickstarter and Discord want in.

item.title: Lost work due to omicron? What to know about unemployment benefits
item.description: The omicron Covid variant is pushing up virus cases and causing workers in areas like New York to lose work shifts. Some may qualify for unemployment benefits.

item.title: Stocks making the biggest moves midday: FedEx, Oracle, Johnson & Johnson and more
item.description: These are the stocks posting the largest moves in midday trading.

item.title: Raising rates would be a positive event for the U.S. economy, New York Fed's Williams says
item.description: The Fed raising rates next year would signal the central bank feels good about the country’s economic recovery, New York Fed President John Williams said.

item.title: JPMorgan hit with $200 million in fines for letting employees use WhatsApp to evade regulators' reach
item.description: Regulators announced Friday that JPMorgan Securities admitted to bookkeeping failures and agreed to pay $200 million to settle the charges.

item.title: Stocks making the biggest moves premarket: Darden Restaurants, Winnebago, FedEx and others
item.description: These are the stocks posting the largest moves before the bell.
